summary: This is a promotional email from the law firm Fried Frank, sharing a published article by partner Evan T. Barr. The article discusses the legal arguments against the federal government's potential civil forfeiture of Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse for the benefit of his alleged victims.

persons.name: Evan T. Barr
persons.context: Authored the article 'Why the Feds Cannot Forfeit Jeffrey Epstein's Mansion' published in the New York Law Journal, discussing the legal hurdles for forfeiting Epstein's assets.

events.title: Publication of Forfeiture Analysis Article
events.description: Evan T. Barr's article 'Why the Feds Cannot Forfeit Jeffrey Epstein's Mansion' is published in the New York Law Journal.

events.title: Firm Distributes Article
events.description: Fried Frank law firm sends an email to its publications list promoting Evan Barr's recently published article on Epstein asset forfeiture.

locations: Manhattan townhouse (Jeffrey Epstein's property, New York, New York)

801 17th Street NW, Washington, DC 20006 (Fried Frank office)
Taunusanlage 18, 60325 Frankfurt am Main, Frankfurt, Germany (Fried Frank office)
keyFacts: The law firm Fried Frank published an article arguing against the federal government's ability to forfeit Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse.
The article, authored by partner Evan T. Barr, was published in the New York Law Journal on September 9, 2019.
The potential forfeiture action by the Southern District of New York aimed to recover assets for distribution to Epstein's alleged victims.
The document is a promotional email from the law firm, highlighting their legal analysis on a high-profile case.
The email lists numerous partners at Fried Frank's White Collar Defense practice as contacts.
